name: AAIController
doc:
AIController is the base class of controllers for AI-controlled Pawns.

Controllers are non-physical actors that can be attached to a pawn to control its actions.
AIControllers manage the artificial intelligence for the pawns they control.
In networked games, they only exist on the server.

@see https://docs.unrealengine.com/latest/INT/Gameplay/Framework/Controller/

ReceiveMoveCompleted: Blueprint notification that we've completed the current movement request
bStartAILogicOnPossess:
By default AI's logic does not start when controlled Pawn is possessed. Setting this flag to true
    will make AI logic start when pawn is possessed
bStopAILogicOnUnposses:
By default AI's logic gets stopped when controlled Pawn is unpossessed. Setting this flag to false
    will make AI logic persist past losing control over a pawn
bSkipExtraLOSChecks: Skip extra line of sight traces to extremities of target being checked.
bWantsPlayerState: Specifies if this AI wants its own PlayerState.
bSetControlRotationFromPawnOrientation: Copy Pawn rotation to ControlRotation, if there is no focus point.

methods.name: GetFocalPoint
methods.doc: Retrieve the final position that controller should be looking at.

methods.name: GetFocalPointOnActor
methods.doc: Retrieve the focal point this controller should focus to on given actor.

methods.name: GetImmediateMoveDestination
methods.doc: Returns position of current path segment's end.

methods.name: HasPartialPath
methods.doc: Returns true if the current PathFollowingComponent's path is partial (does not reach desired destination).

methods.name: ClearFocus
methods.doc: Clears Focus, will also clear FocalPoint as a result

methods.name: SetFocalPoint
methods.doc: Set the position that controller should be looking at.

methods.name: SetFocus
methods.doc: Set Focus for actor, will set FocalPoint as a result.

methods.name: MoveToActor
MoveToLocation
SetMoveBlockDetection
methods.doc: Updates state of movement block detection.

methods.name: SetPathFollowingComponent
methods.doc:
Note that this function does not do any pathfollowing state transfer.
    Intended to be called as part of initialization/setup process

methods.name: UseBlackboard
